item.title: Germany's Jobless Rate Holds Steady
item.description: The German adjusted unemployment rate stood at 5.7% in August, reflecting continued resilience in the labor market, despite signals of a stuttering economy.

item.title: Microsoft to Unbundle Teams Software in Europe
item.description: The software giant says it aims to address concerns raised in an EU antitrust investigation.

item.title: Oil Edges Lower on Weak Chinese Factory Data
item.description: Brent inched down in Europe after data showed Chinese factory activity contracted for a fifth consecutive month in August, but the far larger than expected drawdown in U.S. crude stocks was putting a floor under oil’s declines.

item.title: UBS's 2Q Shows Credit Suisse Upheaval Hasn't Hurt Business
item.description: UBS’s second-quarter results are positive overall, with Credit Suisse’s domestic bank kept, similar targets to pre-acquisition and net inflows that have already turned positive by $8 billion in the third quarter so far, Deutsche Bank said.

item.title: Idalia Churns Through South Carolina as Tropical Storm
item.description: After making landfall on Florida’s Gulf Coast as a major hurricane, the storm moved quickly across Georgia and South Carolina, causing power outages and flooding.

item.title: Adani Rejects Allegations by Organized Crime and Corruption Reporting Project
item.description: Indian conglomerate Adani Group has rejected news reports that quoted documents obtained by the Organized Crime and Corruption Reporting Project that said the billionaire family secretly invested millions of dollars into India’s stock market to buy its own shares.

item.title: Belgian Government Bonds Seen Shielded From Risks of Rating Downgrade
item.description: Belgium’s fragile fundamentals could trigger a rating change but valuations of Belgian government bonds suggest they are shielded from a potential impact, Citi said.

item.title: Pernod Ricard Results Disappoint, Shares Fall
item.description: Pernod Ricard reported below-forecast sales and profit for fiscal 2023, but backed its medium-term financial targets and said it planned a €800 million share buyback. The stock opened almost 5% lower.

item.title: Implats Profits Meet Lower End of Guidance
item.description: Impala Platinum reported sharply lower earnings for fiscal 2023 as production fell, and forecast a 6%-10% rise in costs this year.

item.title: Data Cause Volatility in EUR/USD
item.description: EUR/USD has been highly volatile this week as central banks’ next steps remain dependent on the latest economic data, which are being closely scrutinized by markets, Commerzbank Research said.

item.title: UBS Posts Record $29 Billion Profit on Credit Suisse Deal
item.description: UBS booked a record $29 billion net profit last quarter after it integrated Credit Suisse into its books.

item.title: Japan Looks to Boost Defense Budget by 13% and Add New Missiles
item.description: China tensions loom over $53 billion plan, which raises funds for long-neglected maintenance.

item.title: China's Economy Shows Fresh Signs of Weakness in Factories, Consumer Spending
item.description: Gauges of activity in China’s economy showed signs of weakness in August, heaping extra pressure on policy makers to revive crumbling growth.

item.title: Chinese Steel Platform to Go Public in Hong Kong's First SPAC Merger
item.description: ZG Group has agreed to go public via a merger with a special-purpose acquisition company in what will be the first such deal to take place in Hong Kong.

item.title: EV Boom Remakes Rural Towns in the American South
item.description: A town of 400 people is scrambling to prepare for 6,000 auto workers as a giant Ford plant rises. Locals are excited about the influx of jobs while officials worry about building enough homes and schools in time.

item.title: Reid Hoffman is scaling back his involvement in new deals at venture firm Greylock Partners as he spends more time pursuing artificial-intelligence efforts.
item.description: Reid Hoffman is scaling back his involvement in new deals at venture firm Greylock Partners as he spends more time pursuing artificial-intelligence efforts.

item.title: Workers who make $55,000 a year or less would be eligible for time-and-a-half pay if they log more than 40 hours a week, under a rule proposed by the Biden administration.
item.description: Workers who make $55,000 a year or less would be eligible for time-and-a-half pay if they log more than 40 hours a week, under a rule proposed by the Biden administration.

item.title: Goldman Sachs agreed to pay about $5.5 million to settle allegations it failed to record and retain mobile-device calls its traders made at the onset of the Covid-19 pandemic.
item.description: Goldman Sachs agreed to pay about $5.5 million to settle allegations it failed to record and retain mobile-device calls its traders made at the onset of the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Salesforce shares rose after it said its profit expanded last quarter as it cut costs and leaned into new products that incorporate artificial intelligence.
item.description: Salesforce shares rose after it said its profit expanded last quarter as it cut costs and leaned into new products that incorporate artificial intelligence.

item.title: Visa and Mastercard plan to raise the fees that many merchants pay when they accept customers' credit cards, according to people familiar with the matter and documents viewed by The Wall Street Journal.
item.description: Visa and Mastercard plan to raise the fees that many merchants pay when they accept customers’ credit cards, according to people familiar with the matter and documents viewed by The Wall Street Journal.
